newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU hopes for broad-based government in ex-Zaire.
newsitem.headline: EU hopes for broad-based government in ex-Zaire.

text.p: The European Union said on Thursday it hoped to see a broad-based transitional government in the Democratic Republic of Congo and would send a mission to convey its views to new leader Laurent Kabila.

"The EU expresses the hope that the transitional government will be as broadly-based as possible in order to encompass the political aspiration of all the people of the country," the Dutch EU presidency said in a statement.

"A Presidency-led mission...will convey the Union's views to the new authorities and recommend appropriate next steps, including at a political level, to promote the EU's objectives in the region," the EU said.
"The Union looks forward to the implementation of President Kabila's commitments to convene a constituent assembly within 60 days and to hold elections within two years."
The EU emphasised its concern over the plight of refugees in Congo and urged Kinshasa to ensure that international humanitarian organisations could operate in the country.
"The Union attaches great importance to Mr Kabila's earlier commitments in this regard and urges him to ensure that there is full respect for international humanitarian law," the EU said.
The international medical charity Doctors without Borders on Tuesday accused the new administration of planning to exterminate all Rwandan Hutu refugees in the country.
